issue.title: Squirrel-based Install Dialogue Burns CPU/Fans on Mac

repository.name: Squirrel.Mac
repository.description: :shipit: Cocoa framework for updating OS X apps :shipit:

issue.body:
Please [see this bug filed with VS Code for context/details](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/95534). They suggested I file this with you since they are using this framework.

Let me know if you have any questions!

body:
Just to confirm that I've seen this for various application on various Macs: Slack, WhatsApp, Epic Games.
As mentioned in the VS Code issue, a workaround is to `chown` the application but this obviously has security implications!

issue.title: fix: update Squirel.Mac to fix CPU spin during update

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.body:
Refs: https://github.com/Squirrel/Squirrel.Mac/pull/259
Closes: #29119

Notes: Fixed issue where the update permission prompt would cause 100% CPU spin while the prompt was open

issue.title: Install Helper Tool Install Dialogue Burns CPU/Fans

labels.name: upstream
labels.description: Issue identified as 'upstream' component related (exists outside of VS Code)

labels.name: install-update
labels.description: VS Code installation and upgrade system issues

labels.name: macos
labels.description: Issues with VS Code on MAC/OS X

labels.name: upstream-issue-fixed
labels.description: The underlying upstream issue has been fixed

issue.body:
Issue Type: Bug 1. Leave VS Code open indefinitely (until an update is published). 2. Wait until the dialogue shows that says "VS Code Needs to Install a Helper Tool". 3. Just leave it alone for a bit. Actual: CPU spikes indefinitely, fans start burning, until you put your password into that dialog. Expected: Would really prefer it doesn't do this, as sometimes this happens overnight, and it's just killing trees all night long. ;) I try to remember to close Code when I go away, but I don't always, and I don't think we should have to. BTW, this has happened for a loong time. I just finally got motivated to report. I was kinda surprised not to find it as an open issue, but maybe my search fu is off. VS Code version: Code 1.44.1 (a9f8623ec050e5f0b44cc8ce8204a1455884749f, 2020-04-11T01:47:00.296Z) OS version: Darwin x64 19.4.0
